definition: cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: The Buddha takes his last offerings and makes your perfect in danaparamita. well done, Cunda!
sentences.chinese: 佛陀接受了他的最后的供养并且因为布施而使你最好。

sentences.english: Will donate money to, the brain will be fresh interest to study before karma.
sentences.chinese: 有钱要会布施，脑中才会清爽息念，才会消业障。

sentences.english: A truly charitable person will perform charitable deeds without the thought of getting name or rewards.
sentences.chinese: 真正布施行善的人不要名利，也不求福报。

sentences.english: The festival ends when the monks spray holy water on to the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 仪式以僧侣们向人群布施圣水为结束。

sentences.english: He had given away all his wealth but gained nothing.
sentences.chinese: 全部的财产都布施光了，然而却没获得什么福报。

sentences.english: In Buddhism, the giving of wealth consists of external and internal wealth.
sentences.chinese: 财布施，在佛法里面又把它分为内财与外财。

sentences.english: It's an invisible donation to care for and bless others.
sentences.chinese: 默默的关怀与祝福别人，那是一种无形的布施。

sentences.english: It is superficial to act generously without being free from stinginess.
sentences.chinese: 不能免于悭啬，却做布施之行，是为表面。

sentences.english: The Buddha taught that the wealth one gets Should be given away when needed.
sentences.chinese: 佛说遂愿获取的钱财，必要时要供养布施。

sentences.english: A smile and a kind word are great giving that sow favorable conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一个笑容，一句好话，都是广结善缘的大布施。

sentences.english: You have a give with a mind-set of non - judgmental expectation.
sentences.chinese: 你必须以一种“非判断性期望”的心态去布施。

sentences.english: The power of giving leads to the fountain of receiving.
sentences.chinese: 布施的力量给我们带来了如泉喷涌的收获。

sentences.english: That, Subhuti, is the spirit in which a bodhisattva should practice generosity, not relying on signs.
sentences.chinese: 须菩提，菩萨应如是布施，不住于相。

sentences.english: Generosity is like sown seeds:they yield a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 布施如播种，播种善缘，才能收成。

sentences.english: Grab the opportunity to give, is a blessed man.
sentences.chinese: 掌握机会布施，是有福之人。

definition: to do good works/to be merciful
to give food (as a charity)/"feeding the hungry ghosts" (Buddhist ceremony)
to pray to Buddha/to chant the names of Buddha
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
(Buddhism) to be moved at the sight of good deeds/to join in charitable deeds/to tour temples
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
